title: OnePlus 7T Vs OnePlus 7T Pro: What's The Difference?
text:
OnePlus just unveiled the OnePlus 7T Pro -- the successor to the OnePlus 7 Pro, a few weeks after unveiling the OnePlus 7T. Now, if you're a new buyer, I'm sure you'll want to know what's the difference between the two? Well, we've got all the answers for you. Here's what is different between the OnePlus 7T and 7T Pro.

Design and Dimensions

OnePlus 7T gets a 6.5-inch full HD+ display with a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixels. The OnePlus 7T Pro, on the other hand, gets a larger and sharper 6.67-inches QHD display with a resolution of 1440 x 3120 pixels. OnePlus 7T is more compact and lighter coming at just 190 grams, whereas the 7T Pro is slightly on the heavier side (like the OnePlus 7 Pro) which weighs around 206 grams.

Flat Display Vs Curved Display

OnePlus 7T gets a flat display whereas the OnePlus 7T Pro gets a curved display that tapers around the left and right of the device, giving a premium look and feel.

Notch vs Notch-less

While the display on the OnePlus 7T retains a notch (for the 16-megapixel selfie camera) from the OnePlus 7 (although it is a lot smaller than the one on the OnePlus 7), the OnePlus 7T Pro is completely notch-less. For the front camera, you have a pop-up camera just like the OnePlus 7 Pro.

Hardware

While both phones are rocking Qualcomm's Snapdragon 855+ octa-core processor and Adreno 640 GPU, OnePlus 7T comes in 8GB/128 and 8GB/256GB storage variants. However, OnePlus 7T Pro gets a slightly beefier setup which starts from 8GB/256GB and goes up to 12GB/256GB storage variant (OnePlus 7T Pro McLaren Edition).

Battery

Another place where these phones differ is in the battery. The OnePlus 7T gets a 3800mAh battery, whereas the OnePlus 7T Pro gets a larger 4085mAh battery. Both the devices support WARP Charging capabilities that can charge the phone up to 70-percent in just 30 minutes.

Pricing

OnePlus 7T starts at Rs 37,999 for the 8GB/128GB variant and Rs 39,999 for the 8GB/256GB varinant. OnePlus 7T Pro starts at Rs 53,999 for the 8GB/256GB variant and Rs 58,999 for the 12GB/256GB McLaren Edition.
